statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 signals deeper contraction vs prelim.
market_link: Weaker EU manufacturing tone can weigh global risk sentiment and support duration; EUR-sensitive risk can react via 6E/DX.

statement: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
market_link: Year-end funding tightness can spill into bills/GC repo and front-end rates; mainly a technical unless it persists post-turn.

statement: ECB: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); M1 y/y 5.0% (Oct 5.2%).
market_link: Euro-area liquidity/backdrop can influence EUR rates and EUR-risk correlations; typically second-order vs growth/inflation shocks.

statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; unchanged vs forecast and prior release.
market_link: Limited surprise vs consensus; subcomponents (orders/prices) matter more for rates and equity cyclicality than headline level.

statement: US cash close: MOC buy imbalance reported (S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M).
market_link: Large closing imbalances can drive late-session futures dislocations and increase next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 (flash 51.2); still marginal expansion but less momentum than first read.
market_link: UK/Europe data can influence broader risk tone and EUR/GBP complex; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.
